sample_data.name: BPC-157
sample_data.description: Stable gastric pentadecapeptide with powerful healing and anti-inflammatory properties, derived from gastric protective protein BPC
sample_data.mechanism_of_action: Promotes angiogenesis, accelerates healing of various tissues including tendons, ligaments, muscle, bone, and GI tract. Modulates nitric oxide pathways, growth hormone-IGF-1 axis, and VEGF expression.
clinical_indications: Gastric ulcers and inflammatory bowel conditions

complete_dosing_schedule.acute_injury: 400-500 mcg twice daily for 7-14 days, then 200-300 mcg daily
complete_dosing_schedule.chronic_conditions: 200 mcg daily for 4-8 weeks with 2-week breaks

administration_techniques.preparation: Reconstitute with bacteriostatic water, store refrigerated up to 30 days
administration_techniques.timing: Morning and evening, can be taken with or without food
administration_techniques.rotation: Rotate injection sites every 3-4 injections to prevent irritation

rare_side_effects: Excessive tissue growth (with very high doses)
safety_profile.drug_interactions: Generally safe with most medications, monitor with anticoagulants

precautions: Start with lower doses in sensitive patients
Monitor injection sites for excessive reaction
Discontinue if unusual tissue growth occurs

expected_timelines.long_term_results: Benefits may persist 2-4 weeks after discontinuation

scientific_references.title: BPC 157, a pentadecapeptide with documented healing properties
scientific_references.authors: Sikiric P, Rucman R, Turkovic B, et al.
scientific_references.key_finding: Demonstrates potent healing effects across multiple tissue types

scientific_references.title: Stable gastric pentadecapeptide BPC 157: novel therapy in gastrointestinal tract
scientific_references.authors: Sikiric P, Seiwerth S, Rucman R, et al.
scientific_references.key_finding: Effective in treating various GI disorders

functional_medicine_approach.root_cause_focus: Addresses underlying inflammatory pathways and tissue dysfunction
functional_medicine_approach.integrative_protocols: Combines well with anti-inflammatory diet, targeted nutrients (omega-3s, curcumin), and lifestyle modifications
functional_medicine_approach.biomarker_optimization: Improves inflammatory markers, tissue repair indicators, and functional movement assessments
functional_medicine_approach.patient_empowerment: Educate on proper injection technique, symptom tracking, and lifestyle factors that support healing

cost_considerations.cost_effectiveness: High for injury recovery, moderate for preventive use

sample_data.name: TB-500
sample_data.description: Naturally occurring peptide present in most cells, plays crucial role in wound healing, cell migration, and angiogenesis
sample_data.mechanism_of_action: Promotes cell migration, angiogenesis, and wound healing through actin regulation. Inhibits inflammatory cytokines and promotes tissue repair.

complete_dosing_schedule.athletic_recovery: 5 mg twice weekly during intense training

administration_techniques.preparation: Reconstitute with bacteriostatic water, stable for 30 days refrigerated
administration_techniques.timing: Can be administered any time of day
administration_techniques.special_considerations: Larger volume injection due to higher dose

scientific_references.title: Thymosin β4: a novel regulator of inflammation, angiogenesis, and tissue repair
scientific_references.authors: Goldstein AL, Hannappel E, Kleinman HK
scientific_references.journal: Annals of the New York Academy of Sciences
scientific_references.key_finding: Demonstrates powerful tissue repair and anti-inflammatory properties

functional_medicine_approach.root_cause_focus: Addresses cellular repair mechanisms and inflammatory dysfunction
functional_medicine_approach.integrative_protocols: Synergistic with collagen support, vitamin C, zinc, and regenerative therapies
functional_medicine_approach.biomarker_optimization: Improves tissue repair markers, reduces inflammatory cytokines
functional_medicine_approach.patient_empowerment: Education on injury prevention, proper movement patterns, recovery optimization

sample_data.name: GHK-Cu
sample_data.description: Naturally occurring copper-binding peptide with potent anti-aging, healing, and tissue remodeling properties
sample_data.mechanism_of_action: Stimulates collagen and elastin synthesis, promotes wound healing, acts as antioxidant and anti-inflammatory agent. Chelates copper for enhanced bioavailability.

complete_dosing_schedule.topical_application: Apply 1-2% cream twice daily to affected areas

administration_techniques.topical_method: Clean skin, apply thin layer, allow absorption
administration_techniques.preparation: Pre-mixed solutions available, or reconstitute powder forms
administration_techniques.timing: Evening application preferred for topical use

rare_side_effects: Excessive copper accumulation (with very high doses)

precautions: Perform patch test before full application
Monitor copper levels with extended use

expected_timelines.maintenance_required: Ongoing use needed to maintain benefits

safety_monitoring: Copper levels every 3 months with injections

scientific_references.title: The copper-binding peptide GHK-Cu in skin aging and wound healing
scientific_references.authors: Pickart L, Vasquez-Soltero JM, Margolina A
scientific_references.journal: Journal of Aging Research & Clinical Practice
scientific_references.key_finding: Demonstrates significant anti-aging and wound healing properties

functional_medicine_approach.root_cause_focus: Addresses cellular aging processes and oxidative damage
functional_medicine_approach.integrative_protocols: Combines with antioxidant therapy, collagen support, and healthy aging protocols
functional_medicine_approach.biomarker_optimization: Improves skin elasticity, collagen density, and cellular repair markers

sample_data.name: Semaglutide
sample_data.mechanism_of_action: GLP-1 receptor agonist that enhances glucose-dependent insulin secretion, suppresses glucagon release, delays gastric emptying, and promotes satiety through central nervous system pathways.
sample_data.evidence_level: Level 1A evidence with multiple RCTs showing 15-20% weight reduction and HbA1c reduction of 1.5-2.0%
sample_data.regulatory_status: FDA approved for T2DM and chronic weight management

administration_techniques.technique: Subcutaneous injection using 90-degree angle with provided pen device
administration_techniques.preparation: Remove from refrigerator 15-30 minutes before injection. Check for particles/discoloration.
administration_techniques.timing: Same day each week, any time of day, with or without food

contraindications: Personal/family history of medullary thyroid carcinoma

scientific_references: Wilding JPH, et al. Once-Weekly Semaglutide in Adults with Overweight or Obesity. NEJM. 2021;384(11):989-1002.
Davies M, et al. Semaglutide 2·4 mg once a week in adults with overweight or obesity, and type 2 diabetes (STEP 2). Lancet. 2021;397(10278):971-984.
Rubino D, et al. Effect of Continued Weekly Subcutaneous Semaglutide vs Placebo on Weight Loss Maintenance. JAMA. 2021;325(14):1414-1425.

sample_data.name: Tirzepatide
sample_data.mechanism_of_action: Dual GIP/GLP-1 receptor agonist providing superior glycemic control and weight loss through enhanced insulin sensitivity, delayed gastric emptying, and central appetite suppression.
sample_data.evidence_level: Level 1A evidence with RCTs showing up to 22.5% weight reduction and superior efficacy to semaglutide
sample_data.regulatory_status: FDA approved for T2DM and chronic weight management

complete_dosing_schedule.standard_protocol: 2.5mg weekly × 4 weeks → 5mg weekly × 4 weeks → 7.5mg weekly → 10mg-15mg weekly (maintenance)

administration_techniques.technique: Subcutaneous injection with pre-filled pen device
administration_techniques.preparation: Allow to reach room temperature before injection
administration_techniques.timing: Same day each week, with or without food

contraindications: Personal/family history of medullary thyroid carcinoma

scientific_references: Jastreboff AM, et al. Tirzepatide Once Weekly for the Treatment of Obesity. NEJM. 2022;387(3):205-216.
Frias JP, et al. Tirzepatide versus Semaglutide Once Weekly in Patients with Type 2 Diabetes. NEJM. 2021;385(6):503-515.

sample_data.name: AOD-9604
sample_data.mechanism_of_action: Modified fragment of human growth hormone (hGH) that retains the fat-reducing effects without growth-promoting effects. Stimulates lipolysis and inhibits lipogenesis.
sample_data.evidence_level: Level 2B evidence showing significant fat loss, particularly in abdominal region, with minimal side effects
sample_data.regulatory_status: Human GRAS status in USA, investigational use

administration_techniques.timing: Morning administration, 30 minutes before first meal

expected_timelines.onset: Initial fat loss effects within 2-3 weeks

scientific_references: Heffernan MA, et al. The effects of human GH and its lipolytic fragment on lipid metabolism. Endocrinology. 2001;142(9):3887-97.
Ng FM, et al. Growth hormone fragment 176-191 stimulates lipolysis. Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2000;279(1):77-81.
